definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: In total, only 49 Mersenne primes are known.
sentences.chinese: 目前总共只有49个已知的梅森质数。

sentences.english: The number 17, for example, is prime, because it is divisible only by 1 and 17.
sentences.chinese: 例如17就是质数，因为它只能被1和17整除。

sentences.english: This is also the key to their usefulness.
sentences.chinese: 这也是质数非常有用的关键。

sentences.english: Take the atoms of mathematics, the primes.
sentences.chinese: 例如数学中的原子，质数。

sentences.english: The minimum range of number when extending prime-sieve.
sentences.chinese: 扩充质数筛而找质数时步进的最小间距。

sentences.english: The minimum range of number when extending prime-sieve.
sentences.chinese: 扩充质数筛而找质数时步进的最小间距。

sentences.english: Guide the Number Muncher to all the prime numbers.
sentences.chinese: 引导数字大嘴巴到所有的质数。

sentences.english: If we multiply together all odd primes less than 100, what will be the unit digit of the result?
sentences.chinese: 的奇质数乘起来，所得结果的个位数字是甚么？

sentences.english: Modern internet codes rely on properties of prime numbers.
sentences.chinese: 现代的网络代码依赖于质数的领域。

sentences.english: Reading through a list of primes is like staring at hieroglyphs.
sentences.chinese: 阅读一系列的质数就像是盯着一大堆的天文数字。

definition: composite number (i.e. not prime, has a factorization)
to divide exactly without remainder (in integer arithmetic)/exact division
a nonnegative number (i.e. positive or zero)
